intro: Wittmackia lingulatoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf bat plant, is a rare and striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the humid lowland forests of Brazil, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves that are deeply lobed and resemble the shape of a bat's wing. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically pale green or yellow, with a unique, almost fleshy appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Wittmackia lingulatoides is considered an endangered species.
